018package org.tquadrat.foundation.value;
019
020import static java.lang.String.format;
021import static java.util.FormattableFlags.LEFT_JUSTIFY;
022import static java.util.Locale.ROOT;
023import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.hash;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.isNull;
026import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
027import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNotEmptyArgument;
028import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.padRight;
029import static org.tquadrat.foundation.value.api.DimensionedValue.MATH_CONTEXT;
030
031import java.io.Serial;
032import java.io.Serializable;
033import java.math.BigDecimal;
034import java.util.Currency;
035import java.util.Formattable;
036import java.util.Formatter;
037import java.util.IllegalFormatException;
038import java.util.Locale;
039
040import org.apiguardian.api.API;
041import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
042import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.UnexpectedExceptionError;
043import org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects;
044import org.tquadrat.foundation.value.api.Dimension;
045import org.tquadrat.foundation.value.api.DimensionedValue;
046
047/**
048 *  <p>{@summary A value type for currency values.}</p>
049 *  <p>As there is no constant conversion between currencies, this value type
050 *  not implementing the interface
051 *  {@link DimensionedValue}.</p>
052 *
053 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
054 *  @version $Id: CurrencyValue.java 1072 2023-09-30 20:44:38Z tquadrat $
055 *  @since 0.0.4
056 *
057 *  @UMLGraph.link
058 */
059@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: CurrencyValue.java 1072 2023-09-30 20:44:38Z tquadrat $" )
060@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.4" )
061public final class CurrencyValue implements Cloneable, Comparable<CurrencyValue>, Formattable, Serializable
062{
063        /*------------*\
064    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
065        \*------------*/
066    /**
067     *  The unit for the value.
068     */
069    private final Currency m_Unit;
070
071    /**
072     *  The numerical value for this instance.
073     */
074    private final BigDecimal m_Value;
075
076        /*------------------------*\
077    ====** Static Initialisations **===========================================
078        \*------------------------*/
079    /**
080     *  The serial version UID for objects of this class: {@value}.
081     */
082    @Serial
083    private static final long serialVersionUID = -2075489505691464486L;
084
085        /*--------------*\
086    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
087        \*--------------*/
088    /**
089     *  Creates a new {@code CurrencyValue} instance.
090     *
091     *  @param  unit   The unit.
092     *  @param  value   The value; only absolute (positive) values are allowed,
093     *      a sign will be stripped.
094     */
095    public CurrencyValue( final Currency unit, final BigDecimal value )
096    {
097        m_Unit = requireNonNullArgument( unit, "unit" );
098        m_Value = requireNonNullArgument( value, "value" ).abs().stripTrailingZeros();
099    }   //  CurrencyValue()
100
101    /**
102     *  Creates a new {@code CurrencyValue} instance.
103     *
104     *  @param  unit   The unit.
105     *  @param  value   The value; it must be possible to parse the given
106     *      String into a
107     *      {@link BigDecimal}.
108     *  @throws NumberFormatException   The provided value cannot be converted
109     *      into a {@code BigDecimal}.
110     */
111    public CurrencyValue( final Currency unit, final String value ) throws NumberFormatException
112    {
113        this( unit, new BigDecimal( requireNotEmptyArgument( value, "value" ) ) );
114    }   //  CurrencyValue()
115
116    /**
117     *  Creates a new {@code CurrencyValue} instance.
118     *
119     *  @param  <N> The type of {@code value}.
120     *  @param  unit   The unit.
121     *  @param  value   The value.
122     */
123    public <N extends Number> CurrencyValue( final Currency unit, final N value )
124    {
125        this( unit, new BigDecimal( requireNonNullArgument( value, "value" ).toString() ) );
126    }   //  CurrencyValue()
127
128        /*---------*\
129    ====** Methods **==========================================================
130        \*---------*/
131    /**
132     *  <p>{@summary Returns the amount.}</p>
133     *
134     *  @return The numerical value for this instance of {@code CurrencyValue}.
135     */
136    public final BigDecimal baseValue() { return m_Value; }
137
138    /**
139     *  {@inheritDoc}
140     */
141    @Override
142    public final CurrencyValue clone()
143    {
144        final CurrencyValue retValue;
145        try
146        {
147            retValue = (CurrencyValue) super.clone();
148        }
149        catch( final CloneNotSupportedException e )
150        {
151            throw new UnexpectedExceptionError( e );
152        }
153
154        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
155        return retValue;
156    }   //  clone()
157
158    /**
159     *  {@inheritDoc}
160     *
161     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    The currencies for both values are
162     *      different.
163     */
164    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
165    @Override
166    public final int compareTo( final CurrencyValue other )
167    {
168        if( !m_Unit.equals( requireNonNullArgument( other, "other" ).m_Unit ) ) throw new IllegalArgumentException( "Currency differs" );
169        final var retValue = Integer.signum( m_Value.compareTo( other.m_Value ) );
170
171        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
172        return retValue;
173    }   //  compareTo()
174
175    /**
176     *  Creates a new copy of this value.
177     *
178     *  @return The copy.
179     *
180     *  @see Object#clone()
181     */
182    public final CurrencyValue copy()
183    {
184        final var retValue = clone();
185
186        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
187        return retValue;
188    }   //  copy()
189
190    /**
191     *  Creates a new instance of {@code CurrencyValue} for a different
192     *  {@link Currency}.
193     *
194     *  @param  unit    The {@code Currency} for the new value.
195     *  @param  conversionFactor    The value for this instance multiplied with
196     *      the given factor results in the value for the instance.
197     *  @return The new instance.
198     */
199    public final CurrencyValue copy( final Currency unit, final BigDecimal conversionFactor )
200    {
201        final var retValue = new CurrencyValue( requireNonNullArgument( unit, "unit" ), m_Value.multiply( requireNonNullArgument( conversionFactor, "conversionFactor" ), MATH_CONTEXT ) );
202
203        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
204        return retValue;
205    }   //  copy()
206
207    /**
208     *  {@inheritDoc}
209     */
210    @Override
211    public final boolean equals( final Object obj )
212    {
213        var retValue = this == obj;
214        if( !retValue && (obj instanceof final CurrencyValue other ) )
215        {
216            retValue = Objects.equals( m_Unit, other.m_Unit ) && Objects.equals( m_Value, other.m_Value );
217        }
218
219        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
220        return retValue;
221    }   //  equals()
222
223    /**
224     *  {@inheritDoc}
225     *  <p>The precision is applied to the numerical part only. The width
226     *  includes the
227     *  {@linkplain Currency#getSymbol(Locale) currency symbol},
228     *  too.</p>
229     *
230     *  @note In case the {@code formatter} argument is {@code null}, this
231     *      method throws a {@code NullPointerException} and <i>not</i> the
232     *      usual {@code NullArgumentException}, because this method is usually
233     *      called by instances of {@code java.util.Formatter}, and those do
234     *      not know about our special exceptions.
235     *
236     *  @throws NullPointerException    The {@code formatter} argument is
237     *      {@code null}.
238     *
239     *  @see java.util.Formatter
240     */
241    @SuppressWarnings( "ProhibitedExceptionThrown" )
242    @Override
243    public final void formatTo( final Formatter formatter, final int flags, final int width, final int precision )
244    {
245        if( isNull( formatter ) ) throw new NullPointerException( "formatter is null" );
246
247        var string = toString( formatter.locale(), width, precision < 0 ? m_Unit.getDefaultFractionDigits() : precision );
248
249        if( ((flags & LEFT_JUSTIFY) == LEFT_JUSTIFY) && (width > string.trim().length()) )
250        {
251            string = padRight( string.trim(), width );
252        }
253
254        /*
255         * We do not use Formatter.out().append() because we do not know how to
256         * handle the IOException that could be thrown from
257         * Appendable.append(). Using Formatter.format() assumes that Formatter
258         * knows ...
259         */
260        formatter.format( "%s", string );
261    }   //  formatTo()
262
263    /**
264     *  Returns the unit for the value.
265     *
266     *  @return The unit.
267     */
268    public final Currency getUnit() { return m_Unit; }
269
270    /**
271     *  {@inheritDoc}
272     */
273    @Override
274    public final int hashCode() { return hash( m_Value, m_Unit ); }
275
276    /**
277     *  <p>{@summary Provides a String representation of this value}, in the
278     *  format</p>
279     *  <pre><code>&lt;<i>numerical value</i>&gt;&nbsp;&lt;<i>currency symbol</i>&gt;</code></pre>
280     *  <p>and for the
281     *  {@linkplain Locale#getDefault() default Locale},
282     *  like &quot;{@code 4.50 €}&quot;, where the Locale determines the
283     *  decimal separator.</p>
284     *  <p>The precision is applied to the numerical part only. The width
285     *  includes the
286     *  {@linkplain Currency#getSymbol(Locale) currency symbol}, too.</p>
287     *
288     *  @param  width   The minimum number of characters to be written to the
289     *      output. If the length of the converted value is less than the width
290     *      then the output will be padded by '&nbsp;' until the total number
291     *      of characters equals width. The padding is at the beginning, as
292     *      numerical values are usually right justified. If {@code width} is
293     *      -1 then there is no minimum.
294     *  @param  precision – The number of digits for the mantissa of the value.
295     *      If {@code precision} is -1 then there is no explicit limit on the
296     *      size of the mantissa.
297     *  @return The String representation for this value.
298     */
299    public final String toString( final int width, final int precision )
300    {
301        final var retValue = toString( Locale.getDefault(), width, precision );
302
303        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
304        return retValue;
305    }   //  toString()
306
307    /**
308     *  <p>{@summary Provides a String representation of this value}, in the
309     *  format</p>
310     *  <pre><code>&lt;<i>numerical value</i>&gt;&nbsp;&lt;<i>currency symbol</i>&gt;</code></pre>
311     *  <p>and for the
312     *  {@linkplain Locale#getDefault() default Locale},
313     *  like &quot;{@code 4.50 €}&quot;, where the Locale determines the
314     *  decimal separator.</p>
315     *  <p>The precision is taken from the
316     *  {@link Currency#getDefaultFractionDigits() currency}
317     *  and applied to the numerical part only. The width includes the
318     *  {@linkplain Currency#getSymbol(Locale) currency symbol}, too.</p>
319     *
320     *  @param  width   The minimum number of characters to be written to the
321     *      output. If the length of the converted value is less than the width
322     *      then the output will be padded by '&nbsp;' until the total number
323     *      of characters equals width. The padding is at the beginning, as
324     *      numerical values are usually right justified. If {@code width} is
325     *      -1 then there is no minimum.
326     *  @return The String representation for this value.
327     */
328    public final String toString( final int width )
329    {
330        final var retValue = toString( width, m_Unit.getDefaultFractionDigits() );
331
332        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
333        return retValue;
334    }   //  toString()
335
336    /**
337     *  <p>{@summary Provides a String representation of this value}, in the
338     *  format</p>
339     *  <pre><code>&lt;<i>numerical value</i>&gt;&nbsp;&lt;<i>currency symbol</i>&gt;</code></pre>
340     *  <p>for the given
341     *  {@link Locale}
342     *  that determines the decimal separator, like &quot;{@code 4.50 €}&quot;
343     *  vs. &quot;{@code 4,50 €}&quot;.</p>
344     *  <p>The precision is applied to the numerical part only. The width
345     *  includes the
346     *  {@linkplain Currency#getSymbol(Locale) currency symbol}, too.</p>
347     *
348     *  @param  locale  The locale to use.
349     *  @param  width   The minimum number of characters to be written to the
350     *      output. If the length of the converted value is less than the width
351     *      then the output will be padded by '&nbsp;' until the total number
352     *      of characters equals width. The padding is at the beginning, as
353     *      numerical values are usually right justified. If {@code width} is
354     *      -1 then there is no minimum.
355     *  @param  precision – The number of digits for the mantissa of the value.
356     *      If {@code precision} is -1 then there is no explicit limit on the
357     *      size of the mantissa.
358     *  @return The String representation for this value.
359     */
360    public final String toString( final Locale locale, final int width, final int precision )
361    {
362        final var retValue = toString( locale, width, precision, false );
363
364        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
365        return retValue;
366    }   //  toString()
367
368    /**
369     *  <p>{@summary Provides a String representation of this value}, in the
370     *  format</p>
371     *  <pre><code>&lt;<i>numerical value</i>&gt;&nbsp;&lt;<i>currency symbol</i>&gt;</code></pre>
372     *  <p>for the given
373     *  {@link Locale}
374     *  that determines the decimal separator, like &quot;{@code 4.50 €}&quot;
375     *  vs. &quot;{@code 4,50 €}&quot;.</p>
376     *  <p>The precision is taken from the
377     *  {@link Currency#getDefaultFractionDigits() currency}
378     *  and applied to the numerical part only. The width includes the
379     *  {@linkplain Currency#getSymbol(Locale) currency symbol}, too.</p>
380     *
381     *  @param  locale  The locale to use.
382     *  @param  width   The minimum number of characters to be written to the
383     *      output. If the length of the converted value is less than the width
384     *      then the output will be padded by '&nbsp;' until the total number
385     *      of characters equals width. The padding is at the beginning, as
386     *      numerical values are usually right justified. If {@code width} is
387     *      -1 then there is no minimum.
388     *  @return The String representation for this value.
389     */
390    public final String toString( final Locale locale, final int width )
391    {
392        final var retValue = toString( locale, width, m_Unit.getDefaultFractionDigits() );
393
394        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
395        return retValue;
396    }   //  toString()
397
398    /**
399     *  <p>{@summary Provides a String representation of this value}, in the
400     *  format</p>
401     *  <pre><code>&lt;<i>numerical value</i>&gt;&nbsp;&lt;<i>currency symbol</i>&gt;</code></pre>
402     *  <p>for the given
403     *  {@link Locale}
404     *  that determines the decimal separator, like &quot;{@code 4.50 €}&quot;
405     *  vs. &quot;{@code 4,50 €}&quot;.</p>
406     *  <p>The precision is applied to the numerical part only. The width
407     *  includes the
408     *  {@linkplain Dimension#unitSymbol() unit symbol}, too.</p>
409     *
410     *  @param  locale  The locale to use.
411     *  @param  width   The minimum number of characters to be written to the
412     *      output. If the length of the converted value is less than the width
413     *      then the output will be padded by '&nbsp;' until the total number
414     *      of characters equals width. The padding is at the beginning, as
415     *      numerical values are usually right justified. If {@code width} is
416     *      -1 then there is no minimum.
417     *  @param  precision – The number of digits for the mantissa of the value.
418     *      If {@code precision} is -1 then there is no explicit limit on the
419     *      size of the mantissa.
420     *  @param  useNiceUnit {@code true} if the method
421     *      {@link Dimension#unitSymbolForPrinting() unitSymbolForPrinting()}
422     *      should be used to retrieve the unit symbol, {@code false} if the
423     *      usual one is sufficient.
424     *  @return The String representation for this value.
425     */
426    public final String toString( final Locale locale, final int width, final int precision, final boolean useNiceUnit )
427    {
428        requireNonNullArgument( locale, "locale" );
429        final var unitSymbol = useNiceUnit ? m_Unit.getSymbol( locale ) : m_Unit.getCurrencyCode();
430        final var effectiveWidth = width - unitSymbol.length() - 1;
431
432        final var format = new StringBuilder( "%" );
433        if( effectiveWidth > 0 ) format.append( effectiveWidth );
434        if( precision >= 0 ) format.append( "." ).append( precision );
435        format.append( "f %s" );
436
437        final var retValue = format( locale, format.toString(), m_Value, unitSymbol );
438
439        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
440        return retValue;
441    }   //  toString()
442
443    /**
444     *  <p>{@summary Provides a String representation of this value}, in the
445     *  format that is defined by the provided format String.</p>
446     *  <p>That format String must contain exactly one '%f' tag and one '%s'
447     *  tag; the first takes the numerical value, the second the unit.</p>
448     *  <p>The provided
449     *  {@link Locale}
450     *  determines the decimal separator and the optional thousands
451     *  separator.</p>
452     *
453     *  @param  locale  The locale to use.
454     *  @param  format  The format String.
455     *  @param  useNiceUnit {@code true} if the method
456     *      {@link Dimension#unitSymbolForPrinting() unitSymbolForPrinting()}
457     *      should be used to retrieve the unit symbol, {@code false} if the
458     *      usual one is sufficient.
459     *  @return The String representation for this value.
460     *  @throws IllegalFormatException  The provided format String is invalid.
461     *
462     *  @see java.util.Formatter
463     */
464    public final String toString( final Locale locale, final String format, final boolean useNiceUnit ) throws IllegalFormatException
465    {
466        requireNonNullArgument( locale, "locale" );
467        final var unitSymbol = useNiceUnit ? m_Unit.getSymbol( locale ) : m_Unit.getCurrencyCode();
468        final var retValue = format( locale, requireNotEmptyArgument( format, "format" ), m_Value, unitSymbol );
469
470        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
471        return retValue;
472    }   //  toString()
473
474    /**
475     *  {@inheritDoc}
476     */
477    @Override
478    public final String toString() { return toString( ROOT, -1, m_Unit.getDefaultFractionDigits(), false ); }
479}
480//  class ValueBase
